summary:
Nitrous oxide, often called "laughing gas," is a chemical compound (N2O) with many uses. It's a colorless, sweet-smelling gas that can make people feel happy when inhaled. This effect has led to its use as a recreational drug. However, it's also a powerful medical tool, helping with pain and anesthesia during surgeries.

Beyond medicine, nitrous oxide is an oxidizer in rockets and racing cars and makes whipped cream frothy. On the downside, it's a pollutant and greenhouse gas, mainly from agricultural sources, contributing to ozone depletion and global warming.
title: Nitrous oxide
